solution_line_template: In the first month, the price of the iPhone fell by {first_month_percentage_fall}*${initial_price}=${<<{first_month_percentage_fall}*{initial_price}={price_fall_first_month}>>{price_fall_first_month}}
The new price after the first month is ${initial_price}-${price_fall_first_month} = ${<<{initial_price}-{price_fall_first_month}={price_after_first_month}>>{price_after_first_month}}

In the second month, the price fell 20% further by {second_month_percentage_fall}*${price_after_first_month} = ${<<{second_month_percentage_fall}*{price_after_first_month}={price_fall_second_month}>>{price_fall_second_month}}
The new price after the second month is ${price_after_first_month}-${price_fall_second_month} = ${<<{price_after_first_month}-{price_fall_second_month}={final_price}>>{final_price}}
